alert.note: Alert for Montour; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 10:52PM EST until January 11 at 12:09AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Juniata, Lycoming, Montour, Northumberland, Schuylkill, Snyder, Sullivan and Union. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1048 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is causing minor flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.2 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in more areas with minor flooding. The smaller streams and creeks should crest before 3 AM EST, but the larger waterways may continue to rise for a few hours more. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsport, Bloomsburg, Berwick, Sunbury, Milton, Mount Carmel, Lewisburg, Selinsgrove, Danville, Montoursville, Mifflinburg, Muncy, Watsontown, and Elysburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
